result.execSummary:
The defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: As to both counts: Concurrent. Huber privileges for work. Credit for 3 days time served.
PROBATION REVIEW HRG. SCHEDULED FOR 11-21-14 @ 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Court allows defendant complete conditions through BMCW. A course in anger management. Parenting classes. Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent. Comply with Children's Court Orders, and successfully complete all orders in 14JC230.
No contact with victim unless approved by Children's Court or BMCW AND with mutual desire. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant he is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition for life after this conviction.

Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

timeConds.notes: As to each count: Stayed pending review on 11-21-14.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Facundo Quintana-Ruiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Attorney Craig Johnson seeking additional paperwork.
Letter to Atty. Craig Johnson seeking additional paperwork.
From Atty. Johnson requesting early termination of probation, with letter from agent.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.   Defense request to terminate probation, DENIED at this time, defense can provide postconviction motion in the future to have court re-addresss this issue. Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.   Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned photo CD.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

AS TO COUTN 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Court allows defendant complete conditions through BMCW.
-Serve 30 DAYS (as to each count)  in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim unless approved by b Children's Court or BMCW AND with mutual desire.
-Comply with Children's Court Orders, and successfully complete all orders in 14JC230.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised defendant he is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition for life after this conviction.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Alex Worth. Parties have reached a resolution. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Amended Information Reads:
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 1: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a class B misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Sentencing Memorandum from Defense Counsel.

Defendant requesting modification of the No Contact Order.   Signed and filed, AMENDED No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.Q. (10/6/96), unless as approved per BMCW or Children's Court Orders, and upon mutual desire of M.Q. (10/6/96).

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defense counsel in receipt of new information regarding this case. Defense request for adjourned Final Pretrial to allow for continued negotiations, prior to Jury Trial date, GRANTED. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial in branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato for Cnythia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R. Johnson.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.Q. (DOB:  10/06/1996)

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant has retained private counsel.

Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in court with attorney Craig R Johnson.  Defendant Facundo Quintana-Ruiz in custody.  Gary D Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Christina Green  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
